gastroenterology: Blood in stool or black-colored stool
Vomiting blood or material resembling coffee grounds
Feeling full after eating small amounts
Change in bowel habits lasting more than a few weeks
Fatigue related to poor nutrient absorption
cardiology: Chest pain and shortness of breath
Swelling in legs or ankles (possible heart failure)
Shortness of breath while lying flat
Cold hands or feet with poor circulation
Sharp pain radiating to the arm, neck, or jaw
Unexpected weight gain from fluid retention
Waking up suddenly gasping for air
pulmonary: Shortness of breath during daily activities
Coughing up blood or mucus with unusual color
Sudden shortness of breath at night
Feeling unable to get enough air
Unexplained weight loss with lung symptoms
Frequent use of inhalers without relief
Bluish discoloration of lips or fingertips
endocrinology/metabolism: Fatigue and sensitivity to cold or heat
Mood changes such as irritability or depression
nephrology: Swelling in feet, ankles, or around the eyes
Changes in urination frequency or color
Persistent lower back or flank pain
High blood pressure difficult to control
Nausea and vomiting with kidney discomfort
Shortness of breath due to fluid buildup
hematology oncology: Unexplained weight loss and night sweats
Severe fatigue not relieved by rest
Small red or purple spots on skin (petechiae)
infectious diseases: Painful sores in mouth or genitals
Redness and swelling at wound sites
allergy: Skin rashes or hives after certain exposures
Runny nose triggered by dust or pollen
Swelling of lips, tongue, or throat
Asthma symptoms triggered by dust or pets
Nausea or vomiting after certain foods
Difficulty sleeping due to nasal congestion
rheumatory: Cold sensitivity with fingers turning white
Shortness of breath due to inflammation
Eye redness and pain with joint symptoms
hepato-biliary & pancreas surgery: Unexplained weight loss with digestive discomfort
Nausea and vomiting after fatty meals
Pain radiating to right shoulder or back
Loss of appetite with abdominal swelling
Pain that worsens after alcohol intake
colorectal surgery: Rectal bleeding or blood in stool
Persistent changes in bowel habits
Lower abdominal pain and bloating
Feeling of incomplete bowel emptying
Unexplained weight loss with digestive changes
Chronic constipation not responding to treatment
Frequent diarrhea without clear cause
Narrow or ribbon-like stools
Persistent urge to have a bowel movement
Mucus discharge from rectum
Anal pain or discomfort during bowel movements
Unexplained iron-deficiency anemia
Itching or irritation around the anus
Swelling or lumps near the anus
Unexplained fatigue with bowel symptoms
Uncontrolled leakage of stool (fecal incontinence)
Change in stool color or consistency
Abdominal cramping relieved by defecation
Bowel obstruction symptoms (nausea, vomiting, inability to pass stool)
History of polyps or inflammatory bowel disease with new symptoms
stomach surgery: Early satiety (feeling full after small meals)
Unexplained weight loss with stomach discomfort
Nausea and vomiting without clear cause
Loss of appetite with abdominal discomfort
Pain that worsens after eating fatty or spicy foods
Anemia due to chronic blood loss
Swelling or palpable mass in the upper abdomen
Acid reflux not improving with medication
Unexplained fatigue associated with stomach pain
breast surgery: Lump or thickening in breast tissue
Changes in breast shape or skin texture
Nipple discharge that is bloody or clear
Persistent breast pain or tenderness
Swelling in part or all of the breast
Redness or pitting of the breast skin (peau d’orange)
Nipple inversion or retraction
Unexplained enlargement of one breast
Hardness or thickening under the skin of the breast
Changes in skin color around the nipple
Unexplained weight loss with breast symptoms
Itching or burning sensation in the nipple or breast
Unhealed sore on the breast skin
Swelling or lump in the armpit
Change in breast size over a short period
Visible veins on the breast surface
Warmth or redness suggesting infection or inflammation
Bloody or unusual nipple crusting
Persistent rash on or around the nipple
Unexplained fatigue with breast lump or pain
